column4: can i install server from desktop CD (it's what i have now)??
I guess its possible but you'd be better off just using alternate iso.
It would be a real pita to do it with the desktop cd.  i.e. you'd have to make your own parts chroot to the drive and install ubuntu-server.
err... you might want the server cd not the alternate iso.
i didn't want to d/l another iso just for "server" install ... i should have stick with alternative as i believe it provides pretty much everything opposite to desktop or server only
I dunno if the alternate has server install selection?
me, either. i do know that hoary & breezy do have those. :)
I just run a gui on my server anyh00t dont' really see the reason not to now-a-days hardware wise.  Makes my job less of a headache.
blah humbug. i'm going to find out (booting up vbox).
Oh yeah I forgot I had a virtual machine I could have checked also ah well
just type "server" with alternative :) btw, which virtual machine do u run with? (me, virtualbox)
currently using qemu with the kqemu module.
heh. on another box, i used qemu w/ kqemu. so i thought i could try virtualbox and see how it goes.
looks like pretty much the same, but it seems that virtualbox is responding faster than qemu.
Yeah I might have to check it out.
